title: Lingua
description: Mostly beginner reading material with audio. A lot of them are free, but also has a paid version.

title: World News for Students of French
description: News in French for French learners.

title: Norgeshistorie
description: A lot of free texts about Norway's history. I used it myself, I think it is a great resource.

title: Lær Norsk Nå
description: A podcast with over 100 episodes, with transcripts.

title: Comprehensible Japanese
description: Comprehensible Japanese videos with subtitles on all levels. Some of them are free, majority are paid. I use this myself, it is a great resource to learn Japanese. Highly recommended!

title: Learn Japanese with Noriko
description: A great podcast with transcripts available. I used it myself, it is a great resource, especially for beginner Japanese learners.

title: NHK News Easy
description: A Japanese news site with simplified text. I used it myself, I highly recommend!

title: French Comprehensible Input
description: French comprehensible input videos. It has no transcripts.

title: YouGlish
description: Use YouTube to improve your pronunciation. With more than 100M tracks, YouGlish gives you fast, unbiased answers about how your selected languages is spoken by real people and in context.

title: LinguaCafe
description: It is a self-hosted software that helps language learners read foreign languages.

title: Lute
description: LUTE = Learning Using Texts: learn languages through reading.

title: Natively
description: The Natively community grades each book, movie or TV show to an approximate language proficiency level. This helps you find content that's appropriate for you.

title: Anki
description: Anki is a flashcard memory program which makes remembering things easy.

title: Yomitan
description: Japanese pop-up dictionary browser extension.

title: Sakura tips
description: A slow podcast for beginner Japanese learners with transcripts available.

title: Miku Real Japanese
description: Miku makes videos for Japanese learners. She has a lot of interview videos with subtitles, they have a separate playlist.

title: Game gengo
description: Game gengo makes Japanese grammar videos based on sentences found in video games.

title: Ett Lite Bildeglimt
description: Norwegian listening practice, and comprehensible input videos.

title: OCRmyPDF
description: OCRmyPDF adds a text layer to scanned PDF files, allowing them to be searched and copied.

title: Free japanese fonts
description: 280 Japanese unicode fonts free to download.

title: Nachrichtenleicht
description: A news site operated by Deutschlandfunk that publishes weekly news stories written in simple language for language learners on various topics including current events, culture, sports, and others.

title: DW Deutsch Lernen
description: Resources for german learners provided by Deutsche Welle (DW) including longer form videos, vocabulary, and placement tests. In addition to that, nearly every day, new short form audio broadcasts with manuscripts are posted. Content varies from A1-C2 levels.

title: Slow German
description: A podcast by Annik Rubens with clearly spoken language and transcripts. The topics tend to focus on everyday things, life in Germany, and current events. Manuscripts are available in the description of each episode.

title: SWR2 Wissen
description: A podcast from Südwestrundfunk (SWR). Topics include current events, history, and general education. Manuscripts for each podcast are available directly in the description of each episode or via link to download as a PDF.

title: Moin marc
description: A podcast for learning German via postcard. The host, Marc, reads aloud postcards sent to him. First slowly, and afterwards at a more normal speaking speed. Transcripts are also provided for each episode with the original German and an English translation to follow along.

title: Easy German Podcast
description: A biweekly podcast discussing everyday topics. Episodes regularly include a few segments including "Ausdrücke der Woche" (expressions of the week), "Empfehlungen der Woche" (recommendations of the week), and "Lieder der Woche" (songs of the week). Transcripts are also available, but only to subscribers.
